repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
â€¦h buf_clear

Problem:
Using "use_float" in the if condition was causing a new buffer to be generated on every execution.

Solution:
Remove the incorrect use_float check from the condition and use buf_clear to properly clear the existing buffer.

comment_data.body: why is all of this needed? most tests use the default highlights

Is this about the "info" window? "popup floating window" could refer to either the menu itself or the flyout "info" window. Which is it?

is this a correct description?:


maybe mutliple `<c-n><c-n>` to emphasize that new info windows are being displayed?
```suggestion
        feed('S<C-x><C-o><C-N><C-N>')
```

can this test also assert that multiple info windows were displayed, somehow?

comment_data.body: the cot use default value that mean when trigger omni it select first item <C-N> select two so just one `<C-N>` is enough here otherwise it will select 3 item which use `nvim__complete_set` this will generate a new buffer . because preview buffer is `wipe` when floating window is hide the buffer is removed. calling `nvim__complete_set` will show flaoting window with a new buffer. so now is fine

comment_data.body: You should still use `screen:add_extra_attr_ids()` so you can make use of the default attrs.
